creator: erik.hermans@headbird.com
text:
Older versions of mod_jk passes Negotiate user=user 
This versions passes  Negotiate user=user@DOMAIN 

jk log from  version 1.2.41

[Thu Mar 17 17:18:35.960 2016] [61337:140710048434144] [debug] init_ws_service::mod_jk.c (1196)  ... 
auth=Negotiate user=ehermans@AD-COB.DOMAIN 

jk log from older version

[Thu Mar 17 17:48:53.189 2016] [12825:24] [debug] mod_jk.c (988)... 
auth=Negotiate user=ehermans

This gives incompatibility issues in our application

There are multiple httpd modules that support integration with Windows authentication. This report does not indicate which one is used.

mod_jk simply exposes the value of the provided user name (or the alternative provided by JkRemoteUserIndicator if present)

mod_jk has no control over the user name format used by whatever module authenticates the user.
creator: markt@apache.org
